Plot line or bar graphic

Source: R/fplot.R
fplot.Rd

Function use the dtsm function for plot the results

fplot(
  data,
  type = "bar",
  x,
  y,
  groups,
  xlab = NULL,
  ylab = NULL,
  glab = NULL,
  legend = "top",
  sig = NULL,
  error = "ste",
  limits = NULL,
  brakes = NULL,
  xbrks = NULL,
  gbrks = NULL,
  color = TRUE
)

Arguments

data

Output from ger_testcomp function
type

Type of graphic. "bar" or "line"
x

Axis x variable
y

Axis y variable
groups

Group variable
xlab

Title for the axis x
ylab

Title for the axis y
glab

Title for the legend
legend

the position of legends ("none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top", or two-element numeric vector)
sig

Column with the significance
error

Show the error bar ("ste" or "std").
limits

limits of the y axis
brakes

break of the y axis
xbrks

axis brakes labels in string with double space
gbrks

legend label in string with double space
color

colored figure (TRUE), otherwise black & white (FALSE)

Value

Line o bar plot

Examples



if (FALSE) {

library(GerminaR)
library(dplyr)
data <- prosopis %>% mutate(across(c(nacl, temp, rep), as.factor))
smr <- ger_summary(SeedN = "seeds", evalName = "D", data = data)

aov <- aov(grp ~ nacl*temp, smr)

mc <- ger_testcomp(aov = aov
                   , comp = c("nacl", "temp")
                   )

data <- mc$table

 fplot(data = data
       , type = "line"
       , x = "temp"
       , y = "grp"
       , groups = "nacl"
       , limits = c(0,150)
       , brakes = 20
       , color = FALSE
       )

}
